thread.title: Volleyball: Anderson County tops Oak Ridge - PrepXtra
thread.title_full: Volleyball: Anderson County tops Oak Ridge - PrepXtra Story

author: Mike Blackerby
title: Volleyball: Anderson County tops Oak Ridge - PrepXtra
text:
Anderson County High School's volleyball team bounced back in style after losing its first District 3-AAA game of the year Wednesday at Halls.
After handling Oak Ridge 25-9, 25-8 in the opening two games of the district tournament championship game, the Lady Mavericks dropped a 28-26 decision in Game 3.
No problem, as Anderson County rebounded for a convincing 25-11 victory in the fourth game to claim the title.
"We came out focused and played great (in the fourth game)," said Anderson County coach Jayme Smith.
Both teams advance to the Region 2-AAA semifinals at 6 p.m. Tuesday at Anderson County.
The Lady Mavericks will play the District 4-AAA runner-up and Oak Ridge will take on the 4-AAA champion in the semifinals.
Winners advance to the championship game and qualify for sectional play.
Anderson County downed Gibbs 25-4, 25-9, 25-9 in the semifinals earlier Wednesday night.
Oak Ridge advanced with a 25-9, 25-23, 20-25, 25-18 win over Halls.
Tournament MVP Maddy Taylor had 15 kills to spark Anderson County (42-11) against Oak Ridge.
"She did phenomenal," Smith said. "It's just the power that she has."
Colebee Sumner contributed 23 points, Taylor Payne had 11 kills and Emilee Sturgill recorded 42 assists for the Lady Mavs.
Oak Ridge coach Carmen Foster said her team can build on the momentum of the third-game rally as it heads into region play.
"We just had a talk in the huddle (after the second game)," Foster said. "I basically said â€˜Let's just go out there and fight.' Everything clicked and they did not give up. They fought for every point. We hoped to continue it for two more games, but (Anderson County) played well today. We're not out of it yet, and we can't wait for Tuesday."
Likewise, said Smith.
"The region hasn't been at Anderson County for five or six years," she said. "We're excited about it. We've played everybody in that district except for Bearden, so we have a good idea of what we're up against. We'll bring our best."
Mike Blackerby is a freelance contributor.
